page.title: 11TRAFFIC SURVEY ON THE A120
page.content: Morning and evening rush hours are very busy but the A120 is still quite busy throughout the day with on average 10 vehicles every minute. The majority of the vehicles are cars (70%). Of the remaining percentage 29% are lorries or vans whilst 1% only are motorcycles or bicycles. The A120 carries quite alot of container lorries travelling to and from Felixstowe and Harwich. Little Hadham suffers from the noise and air pollution which results from this traffic. The crossroads in the village have traffic lights because the road is narrow. These lights cause long traffic queues at peak times both during the day and especially at holiday periods. The queue westbound quite often reaches up to Hadham Hall School's drive. Based on a survey by 1C.
